summary: New Zealand shooting sparks new gun laws after 50 killed in mosque attack Australian Brenton Tarrant, 28, a suspected white...
caption: New Zealand shooting sparks new gun laws after 50 killed in mosque attack Australian Brenton Tarrant, 28, a suspected white supremacist, was charged with murder on Saturday. Tarrant was remanded without a plea and is due back in court on April 5 where police said he was likely to face more charges.

summary: डोलियों में दुल्हन की जगह ले जाये जा रहे हैं बीमार
title: डोलियों में दुल्हन की जगह ले जाये जा रहे हैं बीमार
body:
डोलियों में दुल्हन की जगह ले जाये जा रहे हैं बीमार

  • प्रदेश के तीन मैदानी जिलों तक सिमटी सरकार की सभी योजनाएं
  • कई किलोमीटर पैदल चलकर बीमारों को  पहुँचाया जाता है अस्पताल
  • एम्बुलेंस की जगह बीमारों को दुल्हनों की डोलियां और चारपाई ही मात्र सहारा 

देवभूमि मीडिया ब्यूरो 

नैनीताल। आज़ादी के 70  साल बाद आज भी उत्तराखंड के बहुत से ऐसे इलाके हैं जहाँ सड़क के अभाव में ग्रामीण अपने घरों में ही दम तोड़ने को मजबूर हैं। वह भी तब जब पलायन की मार झेल रहे ऐसे गांवों…

View On WordPress

summary: High Eight Sleep Myths That Can Hurt Your Well being
title: High Eight Sleep Myths That Can Hurt Your Well being
body:
These widespread misconceptions about sleep can hurt your well being by holding you from getting high quality zzzz.
People spend roughly one-third of their lives sleeping. Regardless of this, sleep nonetheless stays one thing of a thriller.
Nevertheless, we do know that sleep is deeply related to our well-being, temper, and well being.
An evening of dangerous sleep means extra than simply being grumpy within the morning. Within the brief time period it could imply poor efficiency at work or college. However continual sleep deprivation can result in severe well being issues together with growing an individual’s danger of coronary heart assault and early mortality.
Sleep scientists say that extra must be accomplished to teach the general public about wholesome sleep behaviors – and dispel rumors about unhealthy ones.
A brand new examine revealed within the journal Sleep Well being is doing simply that by taking up pervasive sleep myths and debunking them.
Of their examine, researchers put collectively an exhaustive checklist of misconceptions of sleep and narrowed them all the way down to 20.
The myths have been ranked in accordance with two completely different traits: how false they have been and their potential affect on public well being.
These are the highest eight most dangerous sleep myths from that checklist.

Fantasy #1: Many adults want solely 5 hours or much less of sleep for common well being


Researchers rated this fable as having essentially the most potential hurt on public well being by far.
Ordinary sleep deprivation is related to numerous and
Sleep deprivation will have an effect on your coronary heart (growing danger of hypertension and coronary heart assault) and your thoughts (lowering cognitive functioning and growing danger of despair). Danger of diabetes and weight problems additionally enhance.
For adults, between seven and 9 hours of sleep per night time, and there actually is not a shortcut to get round it.
“There may be variability in how much sleep an individual needs… but I don’t know that in an individual you can change that very much. I think you can get used to less sleep, but you’re getting used to being miserable,” mentioned Dr. Steven H. Feinsilver, director of the Heart for Sleep Drugs at Lenox Hill Hospital in New York Metropolis. Feinsilver was not affiliated with the analysis.

Fantasy #2: Watching tv is an effective solution to calm down earlier than mattress


You are most likely already conscious that this one is a no-no. And it goes for extra than simply tv. Cellphones, tablets, and all types of private electronics usually are not a good suggestion once you’re preparing for mattress.
Researchers have more and more targeted on “blue light” emitted by screens and its impact on sleep and unfavourable sleep-related well being outcomes.
“Beds are for sleeping, one exception. Watching television and the internet are not it,” mentioned Feinsilver.

Fantasy #3: By way of your well being, it does not matter what time of day you sleep


Our our bodies are likely to comply with a pure rhythm of wakefulness and sleep that’s attuned to dawn and sundown for a cause.
Nevertheless, attributable to our careers, households, and social lives, we do not all the time do our sleeping in the course of the night time.
Whereas some missed sleep right here and there is not essentially an enormous deal, shifting your sleep schedule long run is not wholesome.
The examine authors write that people who work night-shift jobs usually expertise circadian rhythm desynchronization and decrease high quality sleep. In addition they have greater danger for well being outcomes together with despair and diabetes.
“Timing of sleep is important,” mentioned the examine’s writer Rebecca Robbins, PhD, a postdoctoral fellow at NYU Faculty of Drugs within the Heart for Healthful Habits Change, “That’s why we see health risks cluster among individuals who work on shift schedules.”

Fantasy #4: Mendacity in mattress with eyes closed is sort of nearly as good as sleeping


Chances are you’ll really feel such as you’re getting ample relaxation mendacity in mattress, even if you cannot fairly get to sleep, however researchers rated this fable as majorly false in addition to doubtlessly dangerous.
All the pieces out of your mind to your coronary heart to your lungs operate otherwise when sleeping in comparison with being awake. If you realize you are awake, the remainder of your physique does too.
“One is either sleeping or awake with little overlap,” write the authors. “Available evidence is showing that cognitive activity when a person is sleeping is distinctly different from wake with eyes closed.”

Fantasy #5: With the ability to go to sleep anytime and wherever is an indication of a wholesome sleep system


“A healthy sleeper actually takes a couple minutes to fall asleep. We do see that if people fall asleep right away… that can be a sign that they are not getting quite enough sleep,” mentioned Robbins.
Sure, it could seem to be a present, however falling asleep immediately, whether or not on an airplane or in a boring assembly, may really imply that you simply’re sleep disadvantaged.
Feinsilver even calls this fable “dangerous, because it minimizes the idea of excessive daytime sleeping as being bad for you or being a sign of something that’s bad for you.”

Fantasy #6: Alcohol earlier than mattress will enhance your sleep


A Pernod digestif after dinner. A nip of brandy earlier than mattress. A few of grandpa’s previous cough drugs. No matter your poison, it will not enable you sleep any higher. In truth, it would doubtless make you’re feeling worse the subsequent day.
“Not only is that tremendously wrong, but it’s also pretty dangerous. It’s really terrible for sleep,” mentioned Feinsilver.
He additionally notes that a nightcap may also .

Fantasy #7: Your mind and physique can study to operate simply as properly with much less sleep


Between work, buddies, and household, who has time for a full night time’s sleep?
“It’s just this common belief that if you try a little bit harder, you might be able to survive the consequences of insufficient sleep. You just adapt a little bit more or you have another cup of coffee and you’ll be able to get by and power through. We hear that all the time,” mentioned Robbins.
Nevertheless, it is simply not true. As a lot as we would wish to suppose we will prepare our our bodies to wish much less sleep, the science says the other.
“All of the evidence shows, without a shadow of a doubt, that chronic insufficient sleep, of five six hours or less, is associated with a host of unfavorable consequences,” she mentioned.

Fantasy #8: Though annoying for mattress companions, loud loud night breathing is generally innocent


Loud loud night breathing is definitely some of the widespread signs of sleep apnea, a dysfunction during which a person can really cease respiration whereas asleep.
Power loud loud night breathing can point out that the airway is being blocked at night time. However not all loud night breathing is an indication of sleep apnea.
Sleep apnea impacts high quality of sleep. So in the event you snore loudly and also you undergo from fatigue or sleepiness in the course of the day, these signs collectively may imply you have got it.
People with different well being situations together with being chubby or overweight, having hypertension, or being a smoker enhance the chance of sleep apnea.

The underside line


In a brand new publication, researchers say that widespread misconceptions about sleep can result in unhealthy sleep behaviors. To combat again towards these sleep myths, they debunked 20 of the commonest of those myths, together with issues like “watching television before bed is a good way to relax,” and “adults need five hours or less sleep for general health.”
Sleep high quality is related to each constructive and unfavourable well being outcomes. Researchers hope that by debunking these myths, people will acquire a greater understanding about sleep and enhance their very own sleep behaviors, thereby additionally enhancing their well being.
“We believe that these myths are one reason that the population hasn’t yet warmed to the idea of making sleep a priority,” saidRebecca Robbins, PhD, a postdoctoral fellow at NYU Faculty of Drugs within the Heart for Healthful Habits Change.
“If we don’t do the intervention work or the public health campaign work to annihilate these myths or address them head on, debunk them, and help people realize and kind of motivate to put into practice the evidence based behaviors, we’re limiting our potential for good sleep and ultimately good health,” she mentioned.

Read the full article

reblog.comment:
These widespread misconceptions about sleep can hurt your well being by holding you from getting high quality zzzz.
People spend roughly one-third of their lives sleeping. Regardless of this, sleep nonetheless stays one thing of a thriller.
Nevertheless, we do know that sleep is deeply related to our well-being, temper, and well being.
An evening of dangerous sleep means extra than simply being grumpy within the morning. Within the brief time period it could imply poor efficiency at work or college. However continual sleep deprivation can result in severe well being issues together with growing an individual’s danger of coronary heart assault and early mortality.
Sleep scientists say that extra must be accomplished to teach the general public about wholesome sleep behaviors – and dispel rumors about unhealthy ones.
A brand new examine revealed within the journal Sleep Well being is doing simply that by taking up pervasive sleep myths and debunking them.
Of their examine, researchers put collectively an exhaustive checklist of misconceptions of sleep and narrowed them all the way down to 20.
The myths have been ranked in accordance with two completely different traits: how false they have been and their potential affect on public well being.
These are the highest eight most dangerous sleep myths from that checklist.

Fantasy #1: Many adults want solely 5 hours or much less of sleep for common well being


Researchers rated this fable as having essentially the most potential hurt on public well being by far.
Ordinary sleep deprivation is related to numerous and
Sleep deprivation will have an effect on your coronary heart (growing danger of hypertension and coronary heart assault) and your thoughts (lowering cognitive functioning and growing danger of despair). Danger of diabetes and weight problems additionally enhance.
For adults, between seven and 9 hours of sleep per night time, and there actually is not a shortcut to get round it.
“There may be variability in how much sleep an individual needs… but I don’t know that in an individual you can change that very much. I think you can get used to less sleep, but you’re getting used to being miserable,” mentioned Dr. Steven H. Feinsilver, director of the Heart for Sleep Drugs at Lenox Hill Hospital in New York Metropolis. Feinsilver was not affiliated with the analysis.

Fantasy #2: Watching tv is an effective solution to calm down earlier than mattress


You are most likely already conscious that this one is a no-no. And it goes for extra than simply tv. Cellphones, tablets, and all types of private electronics usually are not a good suggestion once you’re preparing for mattress.
Researchers have more and more targeted on “blue light” emitted by screens and its impact on sleep and unfavourable sleep-related well being outcomes.
“Beds are for sleeping, one exception. Watching television and the internet are not it,” mentioned Feinsilver.

Fantasy #3: By way of your well being, it does not matter what time of day you sleep


Our our bodies are likely to comply with a pure rhythm of wakefulness and sleep that’s attuned to dawn and sundown for a cause.
Nevertheless, attributable to our careers, households, and social lives, we do not all the time do our sleeping in the course of the night time.
Whereas some missed sleep right here and there is not essentially an enormous deal, shifting your sleep schedule long run is not wholesome.
The examine authors write that people who work night-shift jobs usually expertise circadian rhythm desynchronization and decrease high quality sleep. In addition they have greater danger for well being outcomes together with despair and diabetes.
“Timing of sleep is important,” mentioned the examine’s writer Rebecca Robbins, PhD, a postdoctoral fellow at NYU Faculty of Drugs within the Heart for Healthful Habits Change, “That’s why we see health risks cluster among individuals who work on shift schedules.”

Fantasy #4: Mendacity in mattress with eyes closed is sort of nearly as good as sleeping


Chances are you’ll really feel such as you’re getting ample relaxation mendacity in mattress, even if you cannot fairly get to sleep, however researchers rated this fable as majorly false in addition to doubtlessly dangerous.
All the pieces out of your mind to your coronary heart to your lungs operate otherwise when sleeping in comparison with being awake. If you realize you are awake, the remainder of your physique does too.
“One is either sleeping or awake with little overlap,” write the authors. “Available evidence is showing that cognitive activity when a person is sleeping is distinctly different from wake with eyes closed.”

Fantasy #5: With the ability to go to sleep anytime and wherever is an indication of a wholesome sleep system


“A healthy sleeper actually takes a couple minutes to fall asleep. We do see that if people fall asleep right away… that can be a sign that they are not getting quite enough sleep,” mentioned Robbins.
Sure, it could seem to be a present, however falling asleep immediately, whether or not on an airplane or in a boring assembly, may really imply that you simply’re sleep disadvantaged.
Feinsilver even calls this fable “dangerous, because it minimizes the idea of excessive daytime sleeping as being bad for you or being a sign of something that’s bad for you.”

Fantasy #6: Alcohol earlier than mattress will enhance your sleep


A Pernod digestif after dinner. A nip of brandy earlier than mattress. A few of grandpa’s previous cough drugs. No matter your poison, it will not enable you sleep any higher. In truth, it would doubtless make you’re feeling worse the subsequent day.
“Not only is that tremendously wrong, but it’s also pretty dangerous. It’s really terrible for sleep,” mentioned Feinsilver.

summary: I was feeling reeally crappy earlier bc we had planned to go to out for a picnic but the weather was really overcast and dull so...
body: I was feeling reeally crappy earlier bc we had planned to go to out for a picnic but the weather was really overcast and dull so we didn’t end up going and I just kinda sat around not knowing what to do with myself, but once I put my workout playlist on I felt a bit more energetic so I did a little core / upper body workout. Wasn’t much but it was better than nothing and I feel 100x better for it! I can always rely on Purple Disco Machine and core work to pick up my mood 😊 Going to have some lunch and a shower then we’re going to see Endgame tonight! I cannot wait 😄
